text: Carter Godwin Woodson (December 19, 1875 â€“ April 3, 1950) was an African- American historian. Woodson was one of the first scholars to study African- American history. He started the Journal of Negro History. Woodson was born to James and Eliza Riddle Woodson in Buckingham County, Virginia. He was a famous African-American historian, journalist, author, and founder of the Association for the Study of African American Life and History. title: Carter G. Woodson
